action.primary: Invigorates Blood circulation, dispels Blood Stasis, reduces swellings, opens the channels and alleviates pain

indications: Blood Stasis such as postpartum abdominal pain and amenorrhea
Pain and swelling due to Blood Stasis from fall, fractures, contusions or sprains

contraindications: Contraindicated for those without Blood Stasis.
Contraindicated for those whose lochia has been cleared.
Contraindicated for those with abdominal pain due to Blood Deficiency.
Extremely large doses can cause coma and death.
Do not store in an iron container.

useCases: Strongly promotes the movement of Qi and Blood, breaks up Blood Stagnation and stops pain for abdominal pain from Qi Stagnation and Blood Stasis.
Topically as a wash, for trauma-induced pain and swelling.
Excessive postpartum bleeding with dizziness, blurred vision, vertigo and shortness of breath.
Blood Stasis causing dysmenorrhea, amenorrhea and postpartum abdominal pain.
Promotes the movement of Blood and unblocks menstruation.
Traumatic injury with painful, swollen bruises or hematomas.

notes: This herb is usually used in formulas for Blood Stasis with pain.
This is the heart wood of the Caesalpinia Sappan.
Some sources say that this herb opens the channels and reduces inflammation.
Some sources say that this herb expels Wind and harmonizes the Blood.
Both Su Mu and Flos Carthami #{HongHua} Hong Hua are similar in their actions. Hong Hua is slightly warm and harmonious while Su Mu is slightly cool.
